item.title: EU and India Reach Free-Trade Deal as World Responds to Trump Tariffs
item.description: The agreement is both economies’ largest and will link almost two billion consumers.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Stung by Trump, America’s Top Trading Partners Cozy Up to China
item.description: America’s postwar allies are weighing closer ties to Beijing as they scour the globe for alternative markets.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Iran’s Protest Crackdown Looks Deadlier by the Day
item.description: Rights groups’ estimates grow to 10,000 or more dead as new details trickle out.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Opinion | The Golden Age Arrives, if Not as Planned
item.description: The metal’s rise to $5,000 is a market vote of declining confidence.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Holocaust Education Obscures Antisemitism
item.description: It promotes the myth that Jews can be victims only if they’re powerless and depicted as subhuman.
item.dc:creator: Naya Lekht

item.title: Opinion | China’s Decadence and the Military Purge
item.description: It’s an old lesson: Absolute power leaves those who wield it isolated and confused.
item.dc:creator: Walter Russell Mead

item.title: Trump’s Tariff Threats Designed to Influence Pending USMCA Talks, Canada PM Carney Says
item.description: Carney said he expects a robust review of the continental trade pact, which the Trump administration will lead later this year.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Israel Says It Will Reopen Gaza Border Crossing as Last Hostage’s Remains Are Found
item.description: Returning the remains of Ran Gvili will close a painful chapter for Israelis and pave the way for President Trump’s peace plan to move forward.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Opinion | A Free-Market Milestone for India’s Economy
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is eviscerating his nation’s socialist employment restrictions.

item.title: U.S. Carrier Lincoln Arrives in Middle East Amid Iran Tensions
item.description: The ship and its accompanying destroyers will give President Trump expanded options for a potential strike.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: Orsted, Vestas Shares Rise as European Countries Agree North Sea Wind Pact
item.description: The deal promises to transform the North Sea into the world’s largest clean energy reservoir, according to the U.K. energy secretary.
item.dc:creator: Dominic Chopping

item.title: Iran Is Selling More Oil but Making Less Money
item.description: The decline was largely driven by a web of middlemen and buyers who know Tehran has limited options for unloading its sanctioned crude.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Here in One Kyiv Apartment Building, They Are Freezing—but Not Giving Up
item.description: Russian attacks on energy infrastructure have plunged much of Ukraine into darkness and cold but haven’t broken its resilience.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: The World Economy Is Hooked on Government Debt
item.description: Rearmament, an aging population, technological change and fear of voters are fueling a risky trend.
item.dc:creator: Tom Fairless

item.title: Opinion | What Paris Pays to Keep Le Pen at Bay
item.description: The latest budget is a growth-killing gimmick to avoid an election.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Canada’s Carney Ditches ‘Mr. Nice Guy’ Approach to Trump
item.description: In cutting a China deal and deriding economic coercion, the prime minister has opted for a “hardball” approach as crucial trade talks loom.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: China’s Top General Accused of Giving Nuclear Secrets to U.S.
item.description: Bribery allegations have also been leveled against Gen. Zhang Youxia, whose downfall carries implications for the country’s military readiness.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Opinion | Meet Trump’s Partners in Venezuela
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez is bad news. So are her brother and her rival Diosdado Cabello.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: Europe’s $1 Trillion Race to Build Back Its Defense Industry
item.description: President Trump’s overtures on Greenland’s future are reviving questions inside the NATO alliance about whether Europe can make enough of its own weapons to fight independently of America.
item.dc:creator: Cristina Gallardo

item.title: China Trains AI-Controlled Weapons With Learning From Hawks, Coyotes
item.description: Beijing’s military focuses on swarming drones that can pick off prey or robots that can chase down enemies.
item.dc:creator: Josh Chin

item.title: Israel Quietly Backs New Gaza Militias Fighting Hamas
item.description: The Palestinian fighters live in an Israeli-controlled zone but target Hamas in places that are supposed to be off limits to Israel’s troops.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: The First Three Weeks of the Year Will Reshape the World
item.description: From Davos to Minneapolis, the events of this month have the potential to profoundly change the political and economic landscape for years to come.
item.dc:creator: Greg Ip

item.title: Trump Comments on Afghan-War Veterans Spark Backlash From Allies
item.description: The president backtracked a bit and called U.K. soldiers ‘GREAT and very BRAVE’ after saying allied troops in Afghanistan stayed ‘off the front lines.’
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Trump Threatens New Tariffs on Canada Over China
item.description: The president warned of 100% tariffs on Canadian goods if the North American neighbor “makes a deal with China.”
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: China’s Xi Places His Top General Under Investigation as Military Purges Heat Up
item.description: Gen. Zhang Youxia is the most senior active member of the military hierarchy to face dismissal since the fallout of the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Four Years Ago, He Fled Ukraine for Japan. Now He’s a Sumo Superstar.
item.description: Danylo Yavhusyshyn, known to his opponents as Aonishiki, left his homeland after the Russian invasion to pursue a childhood dream of reaching the top in Japan’s ancient sport.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Pentagon’s New Defense Strategy Strikes Conciliatory Tone on China
item.description: The blueprint says the U.S. will focus attention on the Western Hemisphere while reducing its military role in Europe, South Korea and the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: Syrian President Called the U.S.’s Bluff—and It Paid Off
item.description: His unexpected offensive in northeast Syria claimed huge territory for Damascus and fractured a U.S.-backed militia.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: China Built a Vast Oil Stake in Venezuela. Now It Risks Getting Muscled Out.
item.description: Beijing’s moves bought it sway in Venezuela—all of it now subject to the Trump administration’s preferences in the wake of Maduro’s ouster.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Europe Prepares for a Nightmare Scenario: The U.S. Blocking Access to Tech
item.description: Trump’s threats have injected new urgency into European efforts to reduce its reliance on American technology.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: Treasury ‘Rate Check’ Boosts Yen, Weakens Dollar
item.description: U.S. and Japanese authorities are increasingly worried about the yen, and could be signaling intervention is around the corner.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: With the Fate of Greenland in Flux, It’s Back to the Age of Empire
item.description: The White House is reviving a game of territorial expansion that treats foreign lands as real estate and their people as Americans-in-waiting.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Walker

item.title: Trump Administration Pushes Out Key Officials Focused on China Tech Threat
item.description: The departing staffers worked for a Commerce Department office charged with protecting the U.S. from Chinese technological advances.
item.dc:creator: Amrith Ramkumar

item.title: Team Trump Is Livid After Canada’s Carney Calls Out U.S. Coercion
item.description: Washington and Ottawa are quarreling after the prime minister signaled smaller countries needed to fight back against perceived U.S. bullying.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Former Olympic Snowboarder Turned Suspected Drug Trafficker Surrenders in Mexico
item.description: Ryan Wedding is accused of being associated with the Sinaloa Cartel and was on the FBI’s 10 most wanted list.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: Crackdown on Shadow Fleet Escalates With Seizure of Ship Carrying Russian Oil
item.description: French forces’ boarding of a tanker signaled a more aggressive approach to sanctioned ships that move the oil fueling Russia’s war economy.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: China Sees a Chance to Lure Jaded U.S. Allies
item.description: Beijing has seized upon the disarray within the trans-Atlantic alliance and is trying to entice U.S. allies with the promise of reliable trade partnerships.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: Several People Missing After Landslide Buries Campground in New Zealand
item.description: Debris engulfed the site at Mount Maunganui following record rainfall. A government minister said young people were among the missing.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Trump Wants Peace Board to Rewrite Global Order—but Major Powers Aren’t Sold
item.description: U.S. allies worry about joining an organization that could weaken the U.N. and give equal status to authoritarians such as Vladimir Putin.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Alarm Over Trump’s Greenland Threat Gives Way to Uncertainty Around Future Deal
item.description: There was little clarity about what would happen next after the president made an abrupt reversal in his push to take control of the Danish island.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hinshaw

item.title: The U.S. Is Actively Seeking Regime Change in Cuba by the End of the Year
item.description: After ousting Venezuela’s leader, the Trump administration is hunting for Havana insiders who could cut a deal to end Communist rule.
item.dc:creator: Deborah Acosta

item.title: U.S. Weighs Complete Military Withdrawal From Syria
item.description: The near collapse of the U.S.’s Kurdish allies has prompted the Pentagon to question the benefits of stationing troops in Syria.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Gilt Yields Rise, Sterling Falls as Political Uncertainty Resurfaces in U.K.
item.description: A local district election could usher in the return of Andy Burnham, reports suggested, providing a route back to parliament for the current mayor of Greater Manchester, seen as a figurehead for those on the left of the ruling Labour Party.
item.dc:creator: Renae Dyer

item.title: Trump Has Options in Iran. None Are Likely to Help Protesters Much.
item.description: A U.S. aircraft carrier is heading to the region. If Trump decides to intervene over Tehran’s crackdown, there could be unpredictable consequences.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Falls For Third Straight Month
item.description: The decline indicates the U.K. government has started to contain a rise in debts following a series of tax increases.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Asian Stocks, Bonds Recover as Fears About U.S. Tariffs on Europe Ease
item.description: Asian stocks and government bonds were mostly higher, after President Trump backed down on his threat of tariffs on European countries over their resistance to his Greenland plan.
item.dc:creator: Kosaku Narioka

item.title: The Chinese Spy Machine Infiltrating Taiwan’s Military
item.description: Beijing’s rapidly advancing spying operations have seen agents penetrate the island’s armed forces, enticing personnel to pledge allegiance to China.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: South Korea Economy Weakened in 2025 as Tariffs Took a Toll
item.description: The South Korean economy was bruised by a year of tariffs and political turmoil that slowed annual growth to a five-year low.
item.dc:creator: Kwanwoo Jun

item.title: Inside Trump’s Head-Spinning Greenland U-Turn
item.description: The president ruled out using force to take control of Greenland and called off promised tariffs on European nations.

item.title: Russia Cheers the Growing NATO Rift Over Greenland
item.description: Putin has long sought to undermine the Western alliance that he sees as a threat.

item.title: Market Reaction to Greenland Tensions Has Been Muted, BOE’s Bailey Says
item.description: Bailey said markets were less volatile than might have been expected, but added policymakers must keep a close eye on developments.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Can a U.S.-Greenland Partnership Work? Just Look at These Pacific Islands
item.description: U.S. agreements with three island nations have benefited both sides but have also had challenges.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Pub Owners Turn Against Government in Britain’s Latest Rebellion
item.description: More than 1,000 pubs have banned Labour Party members over a plan to raise taxes. Even hairdressers are refusing service.
item.dc:creator: James Hookway

item.title: British American Tobacco to End South African Manufacturing
item.description: BAT South Africa said it would cease cigarette production in the country because of “the devastating impact of the illicit cigarette trade”.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stonor

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: A Custody Battle Over Dogs Rocks an African Nation
item.description: Palace guard dogs are said to protect Malawi’s president from intruders and witchcraft. The outgoing leader decided to keep a few.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: South Africa Risks Angering Trump by Hosting Navies of Iran, Russia, China
item.description: The military exercises come at a time of already strained relations with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: U.S. Escalates Venezuela Oil Embargo With Two Tanker Seizures
item.description: American special forces boarded a vessel that had been pursued for two weeks, while the Coast Guard seized another tanker in waters off Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Russia Sends Submarine to Escort Tanker the U.S. Tried to Seize Off Venezuela
item.description: The move raises the stakes over the Trump administration’s attempt to seize the Bella 1, which officials say is part of fleet transporting illicit oil.

item.title: Israel Flexes New Diplomatic Muscle in Recognition of Somaliland
item.description: Two years of war have honed Israeli independence on the world stage.

item.title: Modi Taps India’s Consumer Power in Trade Fight With Trump
item.description: The efforts of India’s prime minister to juice consumer spending and bolster the economy are showing signs of success.

item.title: Russia Doubles Down on Allegations Ukraine Targeted Putin Residence
item.description: Officials are using the alleged attack as a pretext to threaten retaliation and a tougher stance in negotiations.

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Immediate Cease-Fire in Border Clashes
item.description: At least 22 civilians—21 in Cambodia and one in Thailand—have been killed since an earlier truce collapsed on Dec. 8.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.

item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.

item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
